Here is a numerical problem for the student to solve:

Let P(x) be the statement "x is a prime number," and let Q(x) be the statement "x is an odd number." Using higher-order logic, express the statement "There exists a prime number that is odd" in formula form.
message_2:
To express the statement "There exists a prime number that is odd" in formula form using higher-order logic, you can use the existential quantifier (∃) as follows:

∃x (P(x) ∧ Q(x))
